You cannot transfer the charge to this vehicle - it has already been paid for some or all of the dates you have selected. Please choose another vehicle or consider applying for a refund .
If the Vehicle Registration Mark is correct but the vehicle description shown is wrong, you can still transfer the charge.
Vehicle information is provided to TfL by the DVLA or DVA, so you'll need to let the DVLA or DVA know if your vehicle details are wrong or need to be updated.
Before paying the Low Emission Zone charge, you may want to view our privacy notice .
You cannot transfer the charge to this vehicle - it has already been paid for some or all of the dates you have selected. Please choose another vehicle or consider applying for a refund .
You can't amend this charge. A LEZ charge can only be changed if both vehicles are subject to the same LEZ charge rate (High or Low).
You will need to select a vehicle that is subject to the same charge as your original vehicle, or apply for a refund .
A Low Emission Zone (LEZ) charge can only be changed if both vehicles are subject to the same LEZ charge rate (Charge High or Charge Low).
You will need to select a vehicle that is subject to the same charge as your original vehicle, or apply for a refund .
Be careful not to mix up the letters 'I ' and 'O ' with the numbers '1 ' and '0 '.
Choose the correct country of registration. You risk getting a penalty if you pick the wrong one.

Based on the vehicle registration (VRM) details that you have entered and the classification information held by Transport for London (TfL) on this day, your vehicle is deemed 100% discounted and you are not required to pay the congestion charge.
If you believe that this information is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, then you can continue.
Please be aware that classification may change without notification, so you should always check to see if payment is required for journeys into the zone.

Based on the vehicle registration (VRM) details that you have entered and the classification information held by Transport for London (TfL) on this day, your vehicle is deemed exempt and you are not required to pay the congestion charge.
If you believe that this information is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, then you can continue.
Please be aware that classification may change without notification, so you should always check to see if payment is required for journeys into the zone.
If the Vehicle Registration Mark is correct but the vehicle description shown is wrong, you can still continue to pay for this vehicle.
Vehicle information is provided to TfL by the DVLA or DVA, so you'll need to let the DVLA or DVA know if your vehicle details are wrong or need to be updated.
We do not hold any details for your vehicle.
UK-registered: If your vehicle’s make and model details have not been returned, please make sure you entered the Vehicle Registration Mark correctly before continuing.
Registered outside the UK: We are unable to display the make, model and colour information. Confirm your details before continuing.
This vehicle either meets the required emission standards, is exempt from the scheme or is subject to a 100% discount.

According to our records your vehicle is subject to the £200 daily LEZ charge. This could be because your vehicle's details are registered with us and it doesn't meet the required Low Emission Zone standards.

If we don't recognise your vehicle details then the £200 daily LEZ charge automatically applies. (For example, if your vehicle is registered outside the United Kingdom.) If you believe your vehicle does meet the required standards, you will need to register it with us .
Until your vehicle is successfully registered you will need to pay the £200 daily LEZ charge every time you drive it within the zone.
Before paying the Congestion Charge, you may want to view our privacy notice .
